compute-admin-flavors.description: Tests Flavors API Create and Delete that require admin privileges

compute-admin-hypervisors.description: Tests Hypervisors API that require admin privileges

compute-admin-tenant-usage.description: Tests Tenant Usage API that require admin privileges

compute-floating-ips-actions.description: Tests Floating IPS API for various actions

compute-floating-ips-actions-negative.description: Tests Floating IPS API for various negative actions

compute-floating-ips-list.description: Tests list operation of Floating IPS API

compute-floating-ips-list-negative.description: Tests negative list operation of Floating IPS API

compute-image-metadata.description: Tests Image Metadata API for CRUD operations

compute-keypairs.description: Tests Keypair API for CRUD operations

compute-security-group-rules.description: Tests Keypair API for rules operations

compute-security-groups.description: Tests Security Group API for CRUD operations

compute-server-interfaces.description: Tests CRUD operations for server interface

compute-quota-get.description: Tests getting quota for compute service

compute-server-volume-attach.description: Tests volume attaching to server operation

compute-volume-list.description: Tests volume listing through compute API

network-floating-ips-admin-actions.description: Tests floating IPs admins` actions of network API

network-dhcp-extra-options.description: Tests dhcp options of network API

network-floating-ips-negative.description: Tests negative operations for floating IPs API

network-subnet-basic-ops.description: Tests networks and subnets basic CRUD operations

network-security-group-ipv6.description: Tests network`s security group IPv6 API

network-security-group-ipv4.description: Tests network`s security group IPv4 API

pcf.description: Tests specific requirements for deploying Pivotal Cloud Foundry on OpenStack

scenario-encrypted-cinder-volumes.description: This test is for verifying the functionality of encrypted cinder volumes.

scenario-minimum-basic.description: This is a basic minimum scenario test.

scenario-network-advanced-server-ops.description: This test case checks VM connectivity after some advanced instance operations executed

scenario-network-basic-ops.description: This scenario test attempts to verify network connectivity

scenario-security-groups-basic-ops.description: This scenario test attempts to verify cross tenant connectivity

scenario-server-advanced-ops.description: This test case stresses some advanced server instance operations: resize and sequence suspend resume

scenario-server-basic-ops.description: This scenario test case follows basic set of operations: boot server, ssh into it, check metadata

scenario-snapshot-pattern.description: This scenario test is for snapshotting an instance and booting with it

scenario-volume-boot-pattern-v1.description: This scenario attempts to reproduce various volume/compute/image operatios with BDM v1

scenario-volume-boot-pattern-v2.description: This scenario attempts to reproduce various volume/compute/image operatios with BDM v2

nova.guidance: By default, designated except scheduler, filter, drivers, API extensions and networking.
nova.comment: All code except driver/plugins listed.  Even for replaceable drivers or plugins, we still expect use of the existing nova service that wraps those interfaces.

filter scheduler driver.description: (Host and cell)  While the line above implies the entire driver is fair game, this case is incredibly common and worth mentioning specifically.

keystone.guidance: Designation is outlined per API grouping. Identity (user and group) management APIs will not be designated. API access (with exception of auth) may be prohibited by policy (resulting in HTTP 403). Designated APIs include both v2.0 and v3 versions where applicable.
keystone.comment: Specific Drivers/Plugins and Identity management code are not designated as many deployments have custom drivers and/or read-only, federated, or externally managed Identity information.

assignment API.description: APIs for managing roles and assignment of roles to user(s)/group(s) for a given scope
assignment API.comment: Some functionality for v2.0 is provided via the 'admin_crud' extension

auth (v2.0) API.description: '/v2.0/tokens' APIs used for v2.0 authentication and token validation/revocation/signing certificates (when PKI tokens are in use)
auth (v2.0) API.comment: This includes the catalog data provided as part of the token body.

auth (v3) API.description: '/v3/auth' APIs used for v3 authentication and token validation/revocation
auth (v3) API.comment: This includes the catalog data provided as part of the token body and '/v3/auth/catalog'.

catalog API.description: APIs for managing services, endpoints, and regions
catalog API.comment: Catalog API is not designated due to the support of template catalog driver which cannot be updated via REST calls. The catalog in the token is considered part of the AUTH APIs.

drivers.description: specific implementations for the keystone API backends (e.g. SQL, LDAP, etc)

ec2 API.description: APIs for managing and utilizing ec2-style credentials
ec2 API.comment: May be required for some OpenStack features in non-keystone services

federation API.description: APIs for managing and consuming federated identity

identity API.description: APIs for managing user(s) and group(s) in a read/write identity store
identity API.comment: Some functionality for v2.0 is provided via the 'admin_crud' and 'user_crud' extensions

notifications.description: CADF notifications for events (authentication, creation of resources, etc)
notifications.comment: Highly recommended and may be required for some features of OpenStack

policy API.description: APIs for managing centralized policy.json distribution for OpenStack services

trust API.description: APIs for managing delegation (via trusts) of roles from one user/group to another user/group

resource API.description: APIs for managing resources (projects/tenants and/or domains)
resource API.comment: In the releases prior to Kilo this is covered by the assignment API

revoke API.comment: Highly recommended and required for Fernet (non-persistent) tokens

glance.guidance: Designated sections are the API implementation code and domain model.

stores.description: the swift, filesystem, and http stores

cinder.guidance: Designated sections are the API implementation code
cinder.comment: Historically, cinder has had plug-ins around schedulers and drivers.

api.description: API section means actually the CODE that exposes the API, not just API-comparability

drivers.comment: there MUST be requirements that it implements what's defined as core functionality in the Cinder API

scheduler.comment: there MUST be requirements that it implements what's defined as core functionality in the Cinder API

neutron.guidance: By default, designated for all code backing required capabilities except plugable components such as plugins, drivers, and API extensions other than those listed below.
neutron.comment: Intentionally replaceable code such as network plugins, ML2 drivers, IPAM drivers, schedulers are not designated.

Core API L3 extension.description: L3 API for floating IPs and routers

Agents.description: Agents if used by relevant driver
Agents.comment: Some drivers require the use of community-developed agents to provide required Capabilities (such as L3 networking). If a product uses such agents, they are designated.

pcftests.guidance: Not a core capability, no position at this time
